author: SteveL-MSFT
body: The current apis are difficult to use which spawned middle-ware like [SHiPS](https://github.com/powershell/ships) and [Simplex](https://github.com/beefarino/simplex).  The downside to these additional layers is performance impact.  Consider having new apis that simplify the PSProvider authoring experience.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Who can design the API? I am afraid that the design and implementation may take several months to work intensively. We have to start now if we want to get this to 6.1.0.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @iSazonov at this time, I don't have any engineers available to design nor implement this.  If you're interested, feel free to tackle this and author an RFC.  Later this month I'm going to re-triage the issues marked for `6.1.0-Consider` and will probably move a bunch to `6.2.0-Consider`.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
Oh, I don't know this code so well to redesign it. I know a few weaknesses and will continue to investigate this code.

It would also be good to have PowerShell Core **roadmap** on next 1-2 years so that the community can work effectively with MSFT.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @iSazonov excellent point about an updated roadmap.  Will work on it and target getting it published by GA time.

comments.author: jzabroski
comments.body: The ideal design pattern for "provider model" (in my opinion) is that of "implicit traits" (Scala) or type classes (Haskell).

title: Provide new interface to implement a PSProvider
